title: Japan Questions Flooding Defenses After Severe Weekend Typhoon
text:
TOKYO—Japan on Tuesday was questioning its defenses against flooding after a larger-than-expected toll from a weekend typhoon, which caused more than 180 rivers to overflow or break their banks.

Although Tokyo and other large cities were mostly spared major damage, floods hit dozens of rural communities across a band hundreds of miles long.
